messages.subject: Re: What's the best current resource for Christian unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: Elissa Wahl had a fairly active group in NW Las Vegas when I lived there (pre-2009). She still keeps a blog: http://christian-unschooling.blogspot.com/ The
messages.messageBody:
Elissa Wahl had a fairly active group in NW Las Vegas when I lived there (pre-2009). She still keeps a blog:

http://christian-unschooling.blogspot.com/

The archives of her Christian Unschooling EZine are here:

http://christian-unschooling.blogspot.com/2008/10/seedling.html

(The links are below the post, but the color format is wonky. Move your mouse over them to get them to appear.)

HTH,

Andrea Q

--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, Sandra Dodd <Sandra@...> wrote:
>
> I know this has come and gone over the years, and there was a book,
> and sites have sprung up and died out.
>
> Is there anything good and current? A discussion list? A blog? A
> NING? Some of all?
>
> I'd like to have it on hand. I have my second-this-week need to know.
>
> Thanks,
>
> Sandra
>

messages.subject: What's the best current resource for Christian unschooling?
messages.msgSnippet: I know this has come and gone over the years, and there was a book, and sites have sprung up and died out. Is there anything good and current?  A discussion
messages.messageBody:
I know this has come and gone over the years, and there was a book,
and sites have sprung up and died out.

Is there anything good and current? A discussion list? A blog? A
NING? Some of all?

I'd like to have it on hand. I have my second-this-week need to know.

Thanks,

Sandra
